TopicTitle: [Question] How old do you have to be to be in FLL (First LEGO League)?

Articles.Content: I love robotics and want to be in FLL (First LEGO League) but I don't know old you have to be.
9-14 in North America. 9-16 outside of North America.

9-14 in North America. 9-16 outside of North America.

Thanks!

- - - Updated - - -

Just wondering, does it have the cost on the website ( www.firstlegoleague.org/ )?

Thanks!

- - - Updated - - -

Just wondering, does it have the cost on the website ( www.firstlegoleague.org/ )? [sELF POST]

9-14 in North America. 9-16 outside of North America.

Never mind, it does. Thanks!

Edited November 17, 2014 by CDK

FLL is pretty fun. I was a leader at a group my church began this year.

I'd advise looking for a local group to join -they'll have their own robots, which aren't cheap, plus more experience/advice about making robots and programs which perform well. Cost will probably vary a little depending on the group.

There's a lot of resources out there if you want to get ahead with the programming- the software for both types of robot is free, but there's you can't guarantee a program will work without a robot to test it on.

I never had FLL experience.

However, I am in FTC (5442 Half Life) and FRC (3410 Team Life). Both have been great learning experiences, and I have helped some FLL teams program their robots. (WOW, the new Lego Mindstorms EV3 is incredible!)

I am also Programming Officer for FIRST in general at our school, so if you need help feel free to PM me.
